alert.note: Alert for Haines Borough and Klukwan; Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 25 at 3:17PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...LONG DURATION HEAVY RAIN AND RISING FREEZING LEVELS THROUGH MONDAY... A warm front will cause precipitation to track into the region from south to north on Friday. A wind shift out of the south with increased speeds will allow warming temperatures through the northern inner channels Friday evening into Saturday. Meanwhile, snow/freezing levels will steadily rise. By Saturday morning freezing levels over the City of Haines and Skagway will likely have risen to around 2,000 feet. During Sunday, these values top out at over 3,000 feet. For this reason, the Highways could see accumulating snow before the warm up. See the latest winter statements for more information. Rainfall totals over this 4 day period will vary as two or more surges of moisture move through, but are likely to reach 0.5-1 inch on Friday and again Saturday, then around 1.5 inches Sunday and Monday. Rain on significant snowpack currently in place can result in several impacts: * Snow will become heavier as it absorbs the rain, making it more difficult to move. * Heavier snow may affect susceptible properties and vessels. * Drainage blocked by snow will cause rainfall runoff and snowmelt onto streets and ponding. * Rain on hard-pack snow will become icy. * Snowmelt from high elevation snow will add to runoff. Please consider your personal property and neighborhood drainage before the onset of heavy rain. Stay tuned to updates from the National Weather Service on this developing pattern change.
